title: Tax hacks: how to save thousands by cutting the ‘other income tax’ we all pay
text:
In Tax Hacks, our columnist Mike Warburton – previously a tax director with accountants Grant Thornton – brings you his best tax-saving tips

This year the Government will collect about £143bn in National Insurance Contributions (NICs), not far short of the £195bn expected from income tax – and yet no-one ever talks about it.

Many think that paying NI is somehow more acceptable than income tax because it is perceived to be spent on socially desirable things. But in reality they are just different ways of collecting tax on your earnings – both are funnelled into the same central government coffers.

More than 90pc of NI receipts in each year goes to paying current state pensions on a pay-as-you-go...
